channel.title: What are your thoughts about subgenres?
channel.description: Today I was thinking about some dnb subgenres: neuro, jungle and experimental. I noticed they almost sound the same. But if they almost sound the same, why are there so many subgenres. Let me know your thoughts!

item.title: What are your thoughts about subgenres?
item.dc:creator: Twizard
item.source: What are your thoughts about subgenres?

item.title: What are your thoughts about subgenres?
item.dc:creator: Tolberto
item.description:
No, IDM = intelligent dance music

item.title: What are your thoughts about subgenres?
item.dc:creator: Twizard
item.description:
Agreed, but there are some really similar dnb subgenres. Take jungle and neuro for example, neuro only sounds a bit more modern

item.source: What are your thoughts about subgenres?

item.title: What are your thoughts about subgenres?
item.dc:creator: Tolberto
item.description:
Also what is IDM? Is that a subgenre or an umbrella term for a group of genres?

Read full topic
item.source: What are your thoughts about subgenres?

item.title: What are your thoughts about subgenres?
item.dc:creator: Tolberto
item.description:
WOOOOOO YEAH !!! I LUV MARTIM GARRICKS 2!!!

Aside from that, sub genres are cool because it helps you find certain music you like. You can’t label house music and dubstep the same genre despite the fact they are both an ‘electronic’ style of music.

Read full topic
item.source: What are your thoughts about subgenres?

item.title: What are your thoughts about subgenres?
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
All these sub genres like future bass and jungle are total bullshspoiler; it’s all about EDM and big room house
